result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney J. Diver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
03:10 pm - Defendant Rodney J. Diver in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm58, 15cm59, 15ct12 and 15cm139.  State moves to Dismiss 15cm59, 15cm139 and Counts 2 and 3 in case 15ct12 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to 15cm58 and Count 1 in 15ct12. Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Finlan/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence 15ct12
WHS/POP 2 yrs
Fine $ 1700 (inclusive of all costs)
Jail 60 days w/Huber for all purposes - Court will allow up to 30 days credit for successful completion of inpatient treatment - To commence on/before 6-5-15 at 8 am
DL revocation 14 months
IID 12 months
Alcohol Assessment/Driver Safety Plan
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Court Sentence 15cm58
WHS/POP 2 yrs CC to 15ct12
Court Costs/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

01:32 pm - Defendant Rodney J. Diver in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15ct12, 15cm58, 15cm139and15cm59.  Finlan states case are not yet resolved.  Requests adjournment for one more pretrial.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
